servinfo.title: DTC P2031: Exhaust Gas Temperature 2 Sensor Circuit

item.ptxt: Conditions for applying fault finding procedures to stored faults:
The fault is declared present after the engine is started or following a road test.
Diesel particulate filter regenerations are inhibited.
The Injection warning light (gravity 1 warning light) is lit.

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: For wiring circuit and connector number, refer to A-5 Engine and A/C Control System Circuit Diagram (DSL) .

entry.ptxt: Short circuit to vehicle body ground
Open circuit or short circuit to +12 V
Check for the continuity, absence of interference resistance and insulation from +12 V for the following connections:

item.ptxt: Between “C87-1” wire of exhaust gas temperature sensor 2 connector and “C86-31” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C87-2” wire of exhaust gas temperature sensor 2 connector and “C86-18” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: Check the continuity, absence of interference resistance and insulation from vehicle body ground of the following connection:

item.ptxt: Between “C87-1” wire of exhaust gas temperature sensor 2 connector and “C86-31” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: Check for the presence of ground on “C87-1” wire of the exhaust gas temperature sensor 2 connector.
Check the exhaust gas temperature sensor 2 resistance between “C87-1” and “C87-2” terminals of the connector according to parameter “Diesel PF in Temp” on Data List of SUZUKI scan tool.

paragroup.ptxt: If the recorded values do not correspond to the above values, replace the exhaust gas temperature sensor 2 of the diesel particulate filter.
If the fault is still present, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
